intro: Baeckea lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Baeckea lancifolia is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
